body_html:
Their intended use is to allow us to create a standard library of JIT functions and modules (from torch.nn and torch.nn.functional). This also leads to a circular dependency issue between torch.nn and torch.jit (hence why they are not in torch/jit/__init__.py).

For now weak script mode is not really supported outside of our internal use cases, but that may change once we port the standard library (though you can try it now with @torch._jit_internal.weak_script).
body_text:
Their intended use is to allow us to create a standard library of JIT functions and modules (from torch.nn and torch.nn.functional). This also leads to a circular dependency issue between torch.nn and torch.jit (hence why they are not in torch/jit/__init__.py).
For now weak script mode is not really supported outside of our internal use cases, but that may change once we port the standard library (though you can try it now with @torch._jit_internal.weak_script).
body:
Their intended use is to allow us to create a standard library of JIT functions and modules (from `torch.nn` and `torch.nn.functional`). This also leads to a circular dependency issue between `torch.nn` and `torch.jit` (hence why they are not in `torch/jit/__init__.py`). 

For now weak script mode is not really supported outside of our internal use cases, but that may change once we port the standard library (though you can try it now with `@torch._jit_internal.weak_script`).
